Description: Typical range for industrial cleaning of hard ceramics like TiC to balance ablation and avoid thermal damage; starting at 100 W for light contamination. Max limited by substrate melting point (~3067°C). Source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs for 1064 nm cleaning heads; academic review in 'Laser Cleaning of Metals' (Optics & Lasers in Engineering, 2018).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Titanium Carbide absorption and minimal substrate interaction
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning of Titanium Carbide surfaces
Optimal repetition rate for continuous cleaning coverage with thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for efficient ablation of Titanium Carbide contaminants
Optimal scanning speed for efficient cleaning coverage
Recommended number of passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning without excessive thermal buildup
